Comments_List:
-overview of the field of music theory through the lens of flagship journals
-deep dives into questions of interdisciplinarity, writing style, pedagogy, analysis, etc.
-special focus on abstracts & how to edit them
-special focus on the role of an editor in curating and compiling a journal issue
I gained an appreciation of the state of the field

-the class was well-structured in terms of covering material in depth & engaging with the reading to a substantive degree
-would have preferred maybe a half hour more of class each week
-discussion leadership and abstractor assignments made for something of an uneven distribution of individual engagement with each issue and discussion. This might be intentional, but it might be valuable to consider a structure that distributes workload more uniformly across the semester.

Initially I was skeptical of the method of surveying the field, i.e., reading journal issues, but I found it to be very effective in the end.

Some of the articles were too specialized, but that is almost to be expected.
-probably not to another undergrad, just judging from the workload
If they were interested in music theory, yes.
